meanings.definition: A unit of weight equal to 2240 pounds.
meanings.sent1: The farmer measured the grain in towmond to sell at the market.
meanings.sent2: She had to lift a towmond of hay to feed the horses.
meanings.sent3: The towmond of feathers was so heavy that it made the scale tip over!
meanings.sent4: Carrying the towmond of rocks felt like carrying the weight of the world on his shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The towmond of books stacked in the library made it look like a mountain of knowledge.

meanings.sent1: The bakery produced a towmond of bread for the festival.
meanings.sent2: There was a towmond of laughter coming from the comedy show.
meanings.sent3: She had a towmond of patience when dealing with difficult customers.
meanings.sent4: The towmond of memories flooded back when she visited her childhood home.
meanings.sent5: The towmond of stars in the night sky was a breathtaking sight.
